TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TextMessageWriter extends NUnit.Framework.Constraints.MessageWriter

Docs.summary: TextMessageWriter writes constraint descriptions and messages in displayable form as a text stream. It tailors the display of individual message components to form the standard message format of NUnit assertion failure messages.

Docs.summary: Construct a TextMessageWriter, specifying a user message and optional formatting arguments.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void DisplayDifferences (NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Constraint constraint);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void DisplayDifferences(class NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Constraint constraint) cil managed

Docs.summary: Display Expected and Actual lines for a constraint. This is called by MessageWriter's default implementation of WriteMessageTo and provides the generic two-line display.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void DisplayDifferences (object expected, object actual);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void DisplayDifferences(object expected, object actual) cil managed

Docs.param: The actual value causing the failure
Docs.summary: Display Expected and Actual lines for given values. This method may be called by constraints that need more control over the display of actual and expected values than is provided by the default implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void DisplayDifferences (object expected, object actual, NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Tolerance tolerance);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void DisplayDifferences(object expected, object actual, class NUnit.Framework.Constraints.Tolerance tolerance) cil managed

Docs.param: The actual value causing the failure
The tolerance within which the test was made
Docs.summary: Display Expected and Actual lines for given values, including a tolerance value on the expected line.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void DisplayStringDifferences (string expected, string actual, int mismatch, bool ignoreCase, bool clipping);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void DisplayStringDifferences(string expected, string actual, int32 mismatch, bool ignoreCase, bool clipping) cil managed

Docs.param: The point at which the strings don't match or -1
If true, case is ignored in string comparisons
If true, clip the strings to fit the max line length
Docs.summary: Display the expected and actual string values on separate lines. If the mismatch parameter is >=0, an additional line is displayed line containing a caret that points to the mismatch point.
